DescriptionText.Text: Transferred to the Military Police stateside after being cleared of a friendly-fire incident. Never wanted to hold the lives of her fellow soldiers in her hands again. Now all bets are off.
Worked with Major Hawkes for the past five years, and has been her most trusted colleague and advisor. Has three daughters back in Hawaii.
Didn't survive a hurricane in Louisiana to be killed by this shit. Laughs in the face of disaster, because what else can you do?
We found him on some kind of weird black ops mission, and he doesn't seem to like us all that much. That's fine, the feeling's mutual.

An administrator at the research wing of Danforth University Medical Center. Grew up poor and joined the military to put herself through school. Now on the board of several charities and political organizations.
Her medical training has made her hyper-vigilant about her own health and diet.
Got into medicine so he could work in remote corners of the world, preferably with the biggest waves. Caught in Danforth visiting old classmates at the hospital.
The sort of person who honestly doesn't care about money. Lives in a small apartment, and spends most of his time with the elderly clients at work.
Learned electrical work from her mom. Learned medical work from Uncle Sam.
Used to host huge Samoan barbecues back in Santa Ana.
A small-town hero and people pleaser. Missed out on a football scholarship at his favorite college ... so the Army is his safety school.
Her mother died of cancer when she was ten. Her faith got her through it. She is committed to making a difference in this world before she sees the next.
Focuses on the small things ... cleanliness, routine, order. Receives surprisingly few complaints.
Lives for the thrill of disabling a touchy IED. Here, at the edge of death, is where he belongs.
Trained as a tank mechanic in the Reserves; now runs a small auto repair business just outside Danforth.
A well-trained army engineer. Apparently, that means he is qualified to fill Hescos.
Refers to his body as his "instrument". Other people refer to him as a "tool".
Married right out of high school, accomplishing step seven in his nineteen-step plan for lifetime success.
After a childhood of first-class luxury, she shocked her parents by enlisting in the Army. She wants to have a "real life" ... whatever that means.
Grew up protecting her little brother from bullies, scoring a few bare-knuckle knockouts before she realized she had a gift.
Hoped the army would take her away from her semi-illiterate family. Has learned to blend into the crowd, despite being the smartest person in the room.
He's the sort of guy who you love the first day you meet him. And then there's the rest of the time.
A huge band nerd in high school. His sister joked that he joined the military mostly for the marching.
Dropped out of college after missing a bunch of exams for a MOBA tournament.
Internet junkie who just wants to make the world a better place.

Everyone gets a weird vibe from this guy. He's treats zombie-killing like it's a game, and talks too much about the "feeling" of taking a life. No one knows how he made it through his last psych evaluation.
Knocked a girl up right before he enlisted, and found out during training. Has never met the kid. Knowing him, it's probably for the best.
Lived on a diet of nachos, cookies, and anime throughout high school. Has had trouble sleeping since he left home.
The Army reminds her a bit too much of high school.
Grew up on a ranch in Montana. Can field dress a deer in a minute and a half.
Believes that everything happens for a reason.
Quit school at fifteen to work in the family restaurant.
His family fled from government death squads as a child. This outbreak is nothing new to him.
Don't let him share his poetry with you.
His dad pressured him into joining the military, hoping it would toughen him up.
Plans to be the next big underground music sensation on the Internet, and being in the Army is his gimmick.
Joined the army because that last brush with the law came a little too close. He needed to get out of town.
About the calmest guy ever to pilot a bird. Says that his unflappable attitude comes from a clean conscience.
Hotshot Army helicopter pilot who tells girls that he flies fighter jets for the Air Force. But not in front of his Army buddies.
She can be self-important and insufferable ... but her cause is just. We're glad we have her here to speak for the helpless survivors still left in the city.
Might hold the key to curing the zombie plague.
Lost her husband twice, once to divorce, and now to death. She's holding it together rather well, considering.
Madison has developed an exhaustive ... one might say carnal ... knowledge of Doctor Horn and his work.
One of Madison's classmates. Not quite up to her level of erudition.
The local medical examiner, who works out of a clinic on the outskirts of town. Had some recent dealings with Thomas Horn.
Thomas Horn's former research partner. Became one of his staunchest critics after they had some kind of falling out.
Dan Bogatz's daughter. Not a huge fan of Thomas Horn.
His parents own the largest food distribution network in the area. We need to keep him alive if we want their help.
Local administrator of the HFF. Worked out of a nearly-abandoned building in the bad part of town. Hard to avoid the impression that something shady was going on over there.
Can fix just about anything... as long as he's got a steady supply of whiskey.
An old country doctor who knows everyone in Trumbull Valley, inside and out.
About as big-hearted and generous as they come. If it were up to him, he'd hand out all his food to anybody who needed it; that's just what people do in a crisis, right?
Used to play one of the zombies in an annual "zombie run" event. Doesn't seem quite so funny anymore. At least she's in great shape.
We're pretty sure that isn't his real name. But we're afraid to say anything. You never know when he might be standing behind you.
The hunter has become the hunted. And then the hunter again. It's complicated. This guy can shoot.
Her friends used to make fun of her annual trip to the Renaissance Faire. They're not laughing anymore.
She's been learning to grow and store her own food for years, waiting for the end times to come.
Zombie apocalypse? Whatever. Try raising five kids.
Direct descendant of Ezekiel Marshall himself. Spends a lot of time in the library, reading about it. Great at research.
Merc Gun
Merc Gun
Merc Gun
Merc Melee
Paid under the table for covert paramilitary work. Knows her way around an AK-47.
A few weeks ago, this was not the kind of guy you wanted to see knocking at your door. Now ... it's a relief to have him around. Him and his land mines.
Alan has been a forest ranger with the Department of Fish and Wildlife since he graduated from community college.
Comes across as a quiet, patient, introspective sort. He's a long-time veteran of the force, and the department frequently partnered him up with rookies, trusting him to show them the ropes.
Invented three new kinds of rocket fuel before he was eighteen.
Pharmaceutical sales executive who suffers from bad luck with the ladies.
Small-town news reporter. Broke the big Orvesco chemical spill story.
Executive VP for a major software developer. Had an expensive snowboarding habit.
Semi-pro fighter with more losses than teeth.
Law student by day, burlesque dancer by night.
Chemistry enthusiast with many happy customers.
Former car thief on parole, trying to go straight.
Drifter, con artist, vegetarian, cat person.
He still owns all the comics your mom threw out.
Grew up on a cattle ranch. Spent an entire summer literally shoveling shit. First in the family to attend college.
Just missed making the Olympic team as a pole vaulter.

NameText.Notes: Stole appearance from 147 GENERIC Virginia Dahlgren.

DescriptionText.Text: Used to be a wild child in college, but confronting the outbreak has sparked a return to the faith of her youth. She meditates daily and commits herself to personal discipline and service to others.
Didn't have time to dig up the old Army uniform before volunteering to help.
Supplies a bonus when assigned to a kitchen
Improved research
Can't we all just get along?
I never really wanted to be big and strong and lug heavy things about... I'm good with it now, though. (Physical powerhouse.)
I never really wanted to be big and strong and lug heavy things about... I'm good with it now, though. (Physical powerhouse.)
People tend to listen when I'm talking. Most of the time that's a good thing. (Leadership skills.)
People tend to listen when I'm talking. Because bad things happen to people who don't. (Leadership skills.)
You gotta fight through the pain. (Max Vitality bonus.)
It's one thing to know how to roll with the punches. It's better if you can avoid 'em all together. (Great reflexes.)
Naturally good shot. (Improves at SHOOTING faster)

DescriptionText.Notes: This line is a reference to the famous Muhammed Ali quote that he'd "float like a butterfly; sting like a bee." It is intended to imply the logical connection between reflexes and melee combat.
DescriptionText.Text: Float like a butterfly... (Improves at FIGHTING faster)
Could trip over a shadow. (Slow to improve at fighting.)
Not the sharpest tool in the shed. (Improves wits s-l-o-w-l-y.)
I'd rather have a bottle in front of me than a frontal lobotomy. (Improves wits slowly.)
A little trouble focusing. (Improves wits slowly.)
You want me to carry WHAT? (Doesn't handle encumbrance well.)
Deep knee bends are not my friend. Shallow ones either. (Crouching is tiring.)
Running sucks. (Improves cardio slowly.)
Running sucks. (Improves cardio slowly.)
One man's trash is another man's treasure. I can find a way to make a buck off just about anything. (Advanced wits.)
After weeks among the infected, he's decided he's never taking that suit off again. Ever. He sleeps in it. No one knows how he uses the bathroom. (Immune to Bloater Gas and Screamer Cries.)
Cracked ribs. This should heal up in a while. (Health penalty.)
Come back later. (Unavailable)
Come back later. (Unavailable)
Come back later. (Unavailable)
Why are we being so passive?
Haven't been eating right... when I've been eating at all.
(Can't work.)
Hard at work, or hardly working
Give me a minute to rest. (Unavailable)
Come find me now!
Prevents character from being visible in the journal.

NameText.Text: Used to track characters that have become sick in order to allow them to recover during gameplay
Used to track characters that have recently been cured from illness so that they don't get sick again immediately.
Used to track characters that have become hurt in order to allow them to recover during gameplay

DescriptionText.Text: Can you see me? I'm invisible!
Can you see me? I'm invisible!
Can you see me? I'm invisible!
Can you see me? I'm invisible!
Can you see me? I'm invisible!
Can you see me? I'm invisible!
Can you see me? I'm invisible!
Hey, let's not get caught up in pointing fingers, right?
You can do it. I'll help.
Did you see me out there today?
I've got big plans. Big plans.
Stick with me, do what I say, and you'll be fine.
We're doing pretty well.
If you're not sure about something, just ask me.
The most important thing, at a time like this, is knowing somebody has your back.
I'm not saying there's nothing to worry about, but there's no need to panic. We're doing pretty well, all things considered.
I learned a long time ago that there are two kinds of people in this world: People who appreciate my sense of humor and people who can go fuck themselves.
I'm fine. Don't worry about me...
I'm such a fuck up. Why do you even keep me around?
I really just don't know what to say.
Hey, if there's anything I can do, just let me know. I'm ready to go. Ready. To. Go.
Sorry, did you say something?
I can't do this right now.
Back off. I don't have time for this shit.
This sucks.
How about getting out of my face? How does that sound?
I've had just about enough of this shit.
Just leave me alone, okay?
It's not my fault, I'll tell you that much.
Am I supposed to just take this abuse day after day?
You're all a bunch of assholes.
I don't want to talk about it.
Are things going to get better? I doubt it.
I don't have anything to say.
I don't know. Whatever you say.
There's no point in any of this. (Suicide risk)
Honestly, I'm not sure we're gonna make it.
Did my hands always shake like this?
I can't remember what it's like not having a knot in my stomach.
Damn. That was too close.
SCARED. I'm not sure we're gonna make it.
I don't know anymore.
I'm not sure we're gonna make it.
I'm not sure we're gonna make it.
We'll be fine as long as we keep working together.
I'm happy to do what I can.
We've got better things to do than sit and chat.
We're going to get through this.
Can't say this is the safest I've ever felt.
I don't know. What do you think?
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Little chance of recovery without medical intervention.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Small chance of recovery every 24 hours.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Good chance of recovery every 24 hours.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Moderate chance of recovery every 24 hours.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Moderate chance of recovery every 24 hours.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Moderate chance of recovery every 24 hours.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Moderate chance of recovery every 24 hours.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Moderate chance of recovery every 24 hours.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Small chance of recovery every 24 hours.
Greatly reduced Vitality and Stamina. Bed rest is advised. Very small chance of recovery every 24 hours.
It's hard to stay focused. I need food. (REDUCED STAMINA.)
It's hard to stay focused. I need food. (REDUCED STAMINA.)
It's hard to stay focused. I need food. (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Can't remember the last time I had a good night's sleep. (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Just a little under the weather. I should be fine, right? Right? (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Just a little under the weather. I should be fine, right? Right? (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Just a little under the weather. I should be fine, right? Right? (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Just a little under the weather. I should be fine, right? Right? (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Just a little under the weather. I should be fine, right? Right? (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Could go at any time.
Could go at any time.
Kicked out of the community.
Once the killing started, I ran. I'm not proud of it, but I am alive.
Once the killing started, I ran. I'm not proud of it, but I am alive.
I'm not proud of what I did. I was just trying to survive.
If we can't defend those walls, there's no point in sticking together.
Hey, call me a coward, but things were going to hell. It didn't make sense to stick around.
No one came to help. Had to get the hell out of there.
Glad to be back with other people again. I got separated and have been scrambling around, just trying to survive.
Had to get out there and find something to eat, but it's too hard trying to survive solo.
I couldn't be a part of this community anymore. I'm sorry.
Just a little under the weather. I should be fine, right? Right? (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Just a little under the weather. I should be fine, right? Right? (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Just a little under the weather. I should be fine, right? Right? (REDUCED STAMINA.)
Stamina will gradually recover while resting at home. It should take about 30 minutes to get back to full Stamina.
Stamina will gradually recover while resting at home. It should take about 1 hour to get back to full Stamina.
Stamina will gradually recover while resting at home. It should take about 1 hour and 30 minutes to get back to full Stamina.
Stamina will gradually recover while resting at home. It should take about 2 hours to get back to full Stamina.
Vitality will gradually recover while resting at home. It should take about 5 hours to get back to full Vitality.
Vitality will gradually recover while resting at home. It should take about 10 hours to get back to full Vitality.
Vitality will gradually recover while resting at home. It should take about 15 hours to get back to full Vitality.
Vitality will gradually recover while resting at home. It should take about 20 hours to get back to full Vitality.
I've been having these headaches ever since that zombie knocked me down. Can't seem to think straight. (Wits XP penalty)
Breathing HURTS with this cracked rib. I can't really run or exert myself too much. (Stamina and Cardio XP penalty)
I can't stop thinking about how those zombies nearly killed me. I'm not sleeping, I'm having flashbacks ... I'm sorry, what were we talking about? (Overall XP and Health penalty)
Those damn zombies left me with this ugly scar, and now nothing will ever be the same. Hey! Stop staring at it! Fuck you! (Touchy)
That zombie hit me pretty hard. Can't seem to focus anymore. (Shooting XP penalty)
It isn't too serious ... but it's a lot harder to swing a weapon with only one decent hand. (Melee XP penalty)
That fight tweaked my back something awful. I'm having a lot of trouble carrying my pack long distances. (Encumbrance penalty)
I used to be a survivor like you. Then I took a zombie to the knee. (Crouching Stamina penalty)
A piece of metal lodged in the body as a result of an explosion or zombie attack. (Health penalty)
A high fever and a lot of pus resulting from a zombie bite. (Health and Stamina penalty)
A powerful slam from a zombie caused massive contusions and internal bleeding. (Health and Stamina penalty)
Scratches from zombies are no joke. They can get very deep, and the risk of infection is high. (Health and Stamina penalties)
Random injury!
Follows player around, even outside of missions.
This character should never be given the Away status.
This character should NOT be at home.
This character should be given the BADASS context tag whenever the player's health is below 40% and there are more than 2 zombies around.
Very good at coordinating large groups of people and multiple interlocking schemes. Always a step ahead of every problem.
A forceful leader who gives orders and expects them to be obeyed. Does not tolerate whining or dissent.
The kind of leader that everyone loves to serve. Puts the needs of individuals first, and their own goals second.
I've seen some fucked-up shit, believe me. (Good in an Infirmary)
Not many people feel like dancing right now. Things are just too goddamn depressing. (Improved Cardio)
Went through the same training gauntlet that shapes every new soldier. Came out with essential combat and survival skills, and the ability to jog all day carrying a full pack.
Learned essential self-defense and investigatory techniques as a well-seasoned law enforcement officer.
Went through the intensive training in marksmanship and decision-making that defines a qualified sniper.
Trained and worked for years as a Special Forces operator, and came away with advanced combat and survival skills.
Trained in the use and disposal of explosive ordnance. (Chemistry Expert)
Trained in the maintenance of armored vehicles. Compared to that, fixing up a civilian car is nothing special. (Tools Expert)
I've been building and repairing bikes since I was twelve years old. (Tools Expert)
Worked in construction for years. (Tools Expert)
Trained in a variety of useful disciplines, from civil engineering to equipment and vehicle maintenance. (Tools Expert)
Left high school early to pursue a mechanical career. (Tools Expert)
Spent years training in a variety of Martial Arts disciplines. Benefits as much from the training in self-calming and meditation as from the combat. (Fitness Expert)
Spends more time at the gym than at home, and could teach half the classes there. (Fitness Expert)
Works out constantly; obsessed with getting huge. (Powerhouse, Bonus Stamina)
Just out of high school, with all the coach's training still fresh on the brain. (Fitness Expert)
Used to executing astonishing feats of physical acumen. (Fitness Expert)
Fights in amateur Mixed Martial Arts bouts, always thinking about going pro. (Melee and Stamina Bonus)
Loves nothing more than the thrill of catching a killer wave. (Cardio Bonus)
Plans to someday execute a 360 no-scope IRL. (Better Wits, Worse Cardio)
It doesn't take much to set you off once you've got a couple shots in you. (Bonus Melee)
Could probably kill everyone in the unit without a weapon. Has trouble respecting others because of it.
Stays on the cutting edge of the medical field, as a matter of professional interest. (Expert in Research and Medicine)
Maintains medic training by providing medication to the clients at a retirement home. Works at the hospital part-time.
Works extra shifts as a paramedic in the inner city, patching bullet holes. Ready at a moment's notice to be called back into service.
You've been taking care of the same few dozen families for the past thirty years. (Medical Expert)
One of the most powerful moments in my life was when I held a beating heart during a surgery.
I've got a huge collection of heads mounted on the walls of my cabin. Don't worry, they're mostly animal heads. (Bonus to Firearms)
I love to cling to life by my fingertips, in the face of certain death. (Physical Powerhouse with Good Reflexes)
There is nothing more exciting than learning something new. (Research Expert and Experience Bonus)
My parents taught me intellectual rigor and discipline from a very young age. I've always thrived in educational settings. (Research Expert, Wits Bonus)
I financed my first car on online poker winnings. (Wits Bonus)
Knows how to get in, get the good stuff, and get out clean. (Bonus to Wits)
Learned how to make backyard bombs on the internet. Posted slow motion videos of friends walking away from explosions. (Chemistry Expert)
The world still has a purpose, and if we work together, we can still do great things.
This outbreak is an punishment for the wicked, and only the truly righteous will survive.
Why won't you listen to me, when I've got all the answers?
The entire internet is full of symptoms that I TOTALLY HAVE. (Minus Health)
An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure. That's why I'm cleaning the stove for the seventh time.
Whenever there is a job to do, you can absolutely rely on me to be somewhere else. (Reduced Stamina)
Everything depends on the fundamentals. The right daily program for sleep, food, and exercise is what really defines a good soldier. (Fitness Expert)
Fear and danger are like a drug. They fill me with energy ... but they probably reduce my life expectancy. (Bonus Stamina, Reduced Health)

DescriptionText.Notes: No need to translate the description. It's an obscure Middle English poem.
DescriptionText.Text: Fratres Carmeli navigant in a bothe apud Eli, Non sunt in coeli quia fuccant uuiuys of heli.
I always get along with my commanding officers. But for some reason, the other grunts don't seem to like me very much. Guess I'm just officer material.
Took over a dozen online courses in picking up women. Wasn't necessarily planning to work in a place where all the women were trained to kill him. (Bonus to Wits, Really Annoying)
Curses like a sailor, especially when talking to sailors.
Never misses a chance to get in a shot at somebody.
Really patient, and genuinely cares about other people.
Translating for family members has produced incredible listening skills and compassion for different types of people.
Joined the military after a couple semesters of college. Hasn't quite figured out what direction to go. (Research Experience)
Would have been the valedictorian, were it not for the distraction of thirteen different extracurricular activities. (Research Experience)
Tested out of high school to work at the family business. (Bonus to Wits)
People come from all over just to smell what I'm cooking. (Cooking Expert)
I post a picture of my dinner every single night for my friends to enjoy. (Cooking Expert)
Will spend all day debating with you over the fine distinctions between different translations of Anime series from the nineties. Whether you are interested or not.
Used to get through church by filling notebooks with memorized sports statistics. They're all still in a closet at home. (Quick Wits)
A dependable person who can step outside of a situation and make the right call, without getting too emotionally involved.
Doesn't take anything too seriously. Worrying only makes things worse.
Nobody's really sure why you're even here.
Can't resist the urge to crack a joke, even at the least appropriate times. Can be a lot of fun ... but can also annoy the shit out of people.
Completely unflappable in the face of danger ... and completely unreasonable in social situations.
Would rather work alone than in a group ... and would rather die than be told what to do.
Doesn't put up with wasted time. Anyone who isn't pulling their weight is bringing everyone else down.
Refuses to kill or exploit animals on moral grounds. Takes great care to manage nutrition. (Bonus Health, Cooking Expert)
Will eat anything and everything. Never seems to suffer any ill effects. (Bonus Health, Resistant to Sickness)
You know that flu that is going around? Never comes around here. (Bonus Health, Resistant to Sickness)
Could be so much more than just another zombie-killing grunt. If only people would listen.
Gets hit on constantly. Really sick of every guy thinking he'll be the "last man on earth".
Has trouble sleeping without his favorite Dakimakura. (Reduced Stamina)
The world is apparently designed for people who see these imaginary colors called "green" and "red". (Difficulty Scavenging)
When your glasses are broken, and all the optometrists are closed for good, it's suddenly a lot harder to find things. (Difficulty Shooting and Scavenging)
The list of things that will kill you is longer than the list of things that won't. (Lower Health)
Always orders five stars ... and complains that it's too bland. (Bonus to Stamina)
Outweighed everyone in school, in every grade. Wears it well, and is in top physical form. (Powerhouse)
Bears a host of meaningful tattoos, all strategically covered by the uniform. (Tattoo Artist)
Doesn't drink or smoke for religious reasons. (Bonus Health)
Is probably a little drunk right now. (Reduced Health and Wits)
Can't sit still in the base when there might be cigarettes out there. (Reduced Stamina)
This is what you get when all those self-esteem-building activities in school actually work. It isn't pretty.
Is absolutely convinced that he is the next Macklemore. Everyone else avoids the subject.
Can read just well enough to scrape by. Dodges any assignment that might require more than that. (Slower Wits)
Never talks about life back home. Wants the past to remain in the past.
Don't forget to be awesome!
Never felt comfortable around guns and violence.
Just super nice. Wouldn't hurt a fly ... unless it was a zombie fly.
Has a wandering mind. Lots of trouble staying on task. Scavenging is a little frustrating. (Slower Wits)
Can't seem to engage with other people on a human level. Might be a sociopath. Or just an introvert.
Doesn't take crap from anybody. Knows what's right and goes for it.
I follow a rigorous daily routine that keeps my body in prime condition, and makes it easier to adapt to new threats. (Advanced Cardio, Faster Combat Skills)
My father took teaching jobs all over the world when I was young. I've had to learn to adapt to whatever comes my way. (Increased Wits)
I never realized how important my faith was to me until everything else was taken away.
Made a bad call in the heat of battle that cost lives. Was never officially blamed for the incident, but can't let go of it. Has become extra cautious as a result.
Some hurts take a lifetime to overcome.
Has been out of contact with spouse and kids since the outbreak began. Constantly dealing with frayed nerves and intrusive thoughts.
My own kids left home years ago, and I guess now I think of everyone in town as my children.
Did everything a certain way back home, and can't imagine why anybody would want to do things differently.
Spent all day at work in a room full of brothers, sisters, parents, and cousins. Learned to navigate stressful social situations like a pro.
Worked in a restaurant since grade school. Knows the ins and outs of a four-course meal. (Cooking Expert)
Lived on the Gulf Coast as a child, and spent months as a refugee from a terrible hurricane. Learned to be smart and self-sufficient.
Has seen and done things that would freeze the blood of a normal human being. That sort of shit changes you.
Hours spent organizing events and debating with the opposition can hone arguing skills to a razor-sharp edge.
You build up some excellent interpersonal skills when you work all day with people on the edge of dementia.
Spent hours blowing into a brass instrument every day ... possibly at the expense of a social life. (Bonus Stamina)
Ever since that IED attack, it's been hard to remember things reliably. (Reduced Wits)
Has an anti-authoritarian streak that stems from being in trouble with the law.
The rest of the family went one way ... and I went the other. I'm accustomed to being alone and self-sufficient.
Got every imaginable shot while traveling in the Pacific. No disease is going to get by this immune system.
Loves to live off the land, leaving the modern world behind. Knows how to get by on very little, and enjoy it. (Wits Bonus)
Practices top-secret Katana moves in the garage. Practices top-secret skulking moves all over the neighborhood. (Bonus to Melee and Wits)
Spends hours at the range every week. Practice makes perfect. (Firearms Bonus)
His ex owns a good chunk of his paycheck. He says he's caught up, but she would disagree.
Mom and Dad were both in the armed services. The house was run like a military unit ... or perhaps a military prison.
I was always the butt of every joke ... and the butt of every snapped towel in gym class.
As a kid, I used to wonder what was inside a squirrel.
In command of this entire operation, and of base Black Friday.
